result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A Emrich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge by 5/26/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail to apply if applicable.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott A Emrich

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Scott A Emrich in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), a class U misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 3 days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 05/26/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.    Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Scott A Emrich in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant is maintaining sobriety, has complete community service and pay assessment fee.    Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Defendant Scott A Emrich in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  The court reviewed the Agreement with the defendant.  
The defendant was advised of his/her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry.
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and found it to be in the best interest of the parties and the general public.
Case adjourned to for review hearing in Branch 6.
  Review hearing scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott A Emrich in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for 05-20-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott A Emrich in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Paul Hauer for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/28/14.
css
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Scott A Emrich in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Defendant Scott A Emrich in custody.  Maureen A. Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
